PAL.NAME: UAG 2010
PAL.DESCRIPTION: Thresholds for Microsoft Forefront Unified Access Gateway (UAG) 2010. Beta version.

ANALYSIS.NAME: ASP.NET Application Restarts

THRESHOLD.NAME: More than 1 ASP.NET application restart per hour
More than 5 ASP.NET application restart per hour

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Number of times the application has been restarted during the web server's lifetime.

ANALYSIS.NAME: ASP.NET Applications Forms Authentication Failure

THRESHOLD.NAME: More than 20 failed forms authentication ticket validations during one hour

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Number of failed forms authentication ticket validations since the application was started.

ANALYSIS.NAME: ASP.NET Applications Request Execution Time

THRESHOLD.NAME: More than 8 sec. to execute request
More than 5 sec. to execute request

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The number of milliseconds that it took to execute the most recent request.

ANALYSIS.NAME: ASP.NET Apps v2.0.50727 Request Execution Time

THRESHOLD.NAME: More than 8 sec. to execute request
More than 5 sec. to execute request

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The number of milliseconds that it took to execute the most recent request.

ANALYSIS.NAME: ASP.NET Apps v2.0.50727 Requests In Application Queue
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The number of requests in the application request queue.

ANALYSIS.NAME: ASP.NET Apps v2.0.50727 Forms Authentication Failure
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Number of failed forms authentication ticket validations since the application was started.

THRESHOLD.NAME: More than 20 failed forms authentication per hour

ANALYSIS.NAME: Active Server Pages Request Execution Time

THRESHOLD.NAME: More than 3 seconds to execute request
More than 6 seconds to execute request

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The number of milliseconds that it took to execute the most recent request.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Active Server Pages Requests Queued
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The number of requests waiting for service from the queue.

ANALYSIS.NAME: .NET CLR Memory % Time in GC
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: % Time in GC is the percentage of elapsed time that was spent in performing a garbage collection (GC) since the last GC cycle. This counter is usually an indicator of the work done by the Garbage Collector on behalf of the application to collect and compact memory. This counter is updated only at the end of every GC and the counter value reflects the last observed value; its not an average.

ANALYSIS.NAME: .NET CLR Memory # Bytes in all Heaps
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \.NET CLR Memory(*)\# Bytes in all Heaps

DATASOURCE.NAME: \.NET CLR Memory(*)\# Bytes in all Heaps
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \.NET CLR Memory(*)\# Bytes in all Heaps

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \.NET CLR Memory(*)\# Bytes in all Heaps
CHART.DATASOURCE: \.NET CLR Memory(*)\# Bytes in all Heaps

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: This counter is the sum of four other counters; Gen 0 Heap Size; Gen 1 Heap Size; Gen 2 Heap Size and the Large Object Heap Size. This counter indicates the current memory allocated in bytes on the GC Heaps.

ANALYSIS.NAME: IPsec DoS Protection Current State Entries
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Current State Entries is the number of state entries in the table. A state entry is a pair of IPv6 addresses that is authorized to pass through from a public to an internal interface.

ANALYSIS.NAME: IPsec DoS Protection Inbound Rate Limit Discarded IPv6 IPsec Authenticated Packets/sec
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \IPsec DoS Protection\Inbound Rate Limit Discarded IPv6 IPsec Authenticated Packets/sec

DATASOURCE.NAME: \IPsec DoS Protection\Inbound Rate Limit Discarded IPv6 IPsec Authenticated Packets/sec
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \IPsec DoS Protection\Inbound Rate Limit Discarded IPv6 IPsec Authenticated Packets/sec

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \IPsec DoS Protection\Inbound Rate Limit Discarded IPv6 IPsec Authenticated Packets/sec
CHART.DATASOURCE: \IPsec DoS Protection\Inbound Rate Limit Discarded IPv6 IPsec Authenticated Packets/sec

THRESHOLD.NAME: More than 100 discarded IPv6 IPsec packets per sec

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Inbound Rate Limit Discarded IPv6 IPsec Authenticated Packets per Second is the rate at which authenticated IKEv1, IKEv2, AuthIP, or ESP IPv6 packets are received on a public interface and discarded because they exceed the rate limit for IPv6 IPsec authenticated packets. An authenticated packet is an IPsec packet with an associated state entry. A state entry is a pair of IPv6 addresses that is authorized to pass through from a public to an internal interface.

ANALYSIS.NAME: IPsec DoS Protection Inbound Rate Limit Discarded ICMPv6 Packets/sec
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \IPsec DoS Protection\Inbound Rate Limit Discarded ICMPv6 Packets/sec

DATASOURCE.NAME: \IPsec DoS Protection\Inbound Rate Limit Discarded ICMPv6 Packets/sec
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \IPsec DoS Protection\Inbound Rate Limit Discarded ICMPv6 Packets/sec

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \IPsec DoS Protection\Inbound Rate Limit Discarded ICMPv6 Packets/sec
CHART.DATASOURCE: \IPsec DoS Protection\Inbound Rate Limit Discarded ICMPv6 Packets/sec

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Inbound Rate Limit Discarded ICMPv6 Packets per Second is the rate at which ICMPv6 packets are received on a public interface and discarded because they exceeded the rate limit for ICMPv6 packets.

ANALYSIS.NAME: IPsec DoS Protection Inbound Rate Limit Discarded IPv6 IPsec Unauthenticated Packets/sec
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \IPsec DoS Protection\Inbound Rate Limit Discarded IPv6 IPsec Unauthenticated Packets/sec

DATASOURCE.NAME: \IPsec DoS Protection\Inbound Rate Limit Discarded IPv6 IPsec Unauthenticated Packets/sec
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \IPsec DoS Protection\Inbound Rate Limit Discarded IPv6 IPsec Unauthenticated Packets/sec

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \IPsec DoS Protection\Inbound Rate Limit Discarded IPv6 IPsec Unauthenticated Packets/sec
CHART.DATASOURCE: \IPsec DoS Protection\Inbound Rate Limit Discarded IPv6 IPsec Unauthenticated Packets/sec

THRESHOLD.NAME: More than 100 discarded IPv6 IPsec packets per sec

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Inbound Rate Limit Discarded IPv6 IPsec Unauthenticated Packets per Second is the rate of unauthenticated IKEv1, IKEv2, AuthIP, or ESP IPv6 packets received on a public interface and discarded because they exceeded the rate limit for IPv6 IPsec unauthenticated packets. An unauthenticated packet is an IPsec packet without an associated state entry. A state entry is a pair of IPv6 addresses that is authorized to pass through from a public to an internal interface.

ANALYSIS.NAME: IPsec AuthIP IPv6 Failed Main Mode Negotiations
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Failed Main Mode Negotiations is the number of failed main mode negotiations since IPsec was last started.

ANALYSIS.NAME: IPsec Driver Packets That Failed Replay Detection/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Packets That Failed Replay Detection per Second is the rate of packets that contained an invalid sequence number since the computer was last started. Increases in this counter might indicate a network problem or replay attack.

ANALYSIS.NAME: IPsec Driver Incorrect SPI Packets/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Incorrect SPI packets per Second is the rate of packets for which the Security Parameter Index (SPI) was incorrect since the computer was last started. A large number of packets with bad SPIs within a short amount of time might indicate a packet spoofing attack.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Teredo Server In - Teredo Server Total Packets: Success + Error / sec
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \Teredo Server(Default)\In - Teredo Server Total Packets: Success + Error / sec

DATASOURCE.NAME: \Teredo Server(Default)\In - Teredo Server Total Packets: Success + Error / sec
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \Teredo Server(Default)\In - Teredo Server Total Packets: Success + Error / sec

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \Teredo Server(Default)\In - Teredo Server Total Packets: Success + Error / sec
CHART.DATASOURCE: \Teredo Server(Default)\In - Teredo Server Total Packets: Success + Error / sec

THRESHOLD.NAME: No Teredo traffic or Direct Access disabled

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Rate of total packets received by the Teredo server.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Forefront UAG DNS64 Dropped Queries

THRESHOLD.NAME: More than 5 quesries dropped per sec.

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Queries dropped by the DNS64

ANALYSIS.NAME: Forefront UAG DNS64 Total Query Average Processing Time
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \Forefront UAG DNS64\Total Query Average Processing Time

DATASOURCE.NAME: \Forefront UAG DNS64\Total Query Average Processing Time
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \Forefront UAG DNS64\Total Query Average Processing Time

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \Forefront UAG DNS64\Total Query Average Processing Time
CHART.DATASOURCE: \Forefront UAG DNS64\Total Query Average Processing Time

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The average processing time of all queries.

ANALYSIS.NAME: IPHTTPS Global Errors - Authentication Errors
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Total authentication errors.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Web Service Current Blocked Async I/O Requests
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Current requests temporarily blocked due to bandwidth throttling settings.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Terminal Service Gateway Connection request authorization time
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Shows the average connection request authentication and authorization times in seconds.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Terminal Service Gateway % Failed Connections

DATASOURCE.NAME: \Terminal Service Gateway\% Failed Connections

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Shows the number of requests that were successfully processed and connected

ANALYSIS.NAME: NPS Authentication Clients Bad Authenticators / sec.
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The average number of RADIUS packets per second that contain an invalid Message Authenticator attribute.

ANALYSIS.NAME: NPS Authentication Clients Dropped Packets
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The number of incoming packets that are silently discarded for a reason other than "malformed," "invalid Message Authenticator," or "unknown type".

ANALYSIS.NAME: NPS Policy Engine Pending Requests
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The number of requests that have entered the policy engine but have not yet completed the process.

ANALYSIS.NAME: NPS Policy Engine Last Round-Trip Time
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The interval (in hundredths of a second) between the most recent request to the policy engine and its response.

ANALYSIS.NAME: NPS Authentication Clients Malformed Packets / sec.
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The average number of packets containing malformed data received per second.

ANALYSIS.NAME: NPS Authentication Clients Unknown Type / sec.
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The average number of unknown type (non-RADIUS) packets received per second.

PAL.QUESTION: Direct Access used?

ANALYSIS.NAME: Active Server Pages Requests Not Found
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The number of requests for files that were no found.

ANALYSIS.NAME: NPS Authentication Server Bad Authenticators

THRESHOLD.NAME: At least one invalid Message Authenticator per sec.

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The number of RADIUS packets that contain an invalid Message Authenticator attribute.

ANALYSIS.NAME: NPS Authentication Server Dropped Packets
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The number of incoming packets that are silently discarded for a reason other than "malformed," "invalid Message Authenticator," or "unknown type".

ANALYSIS.NAME: NPS Authentication Server Invalid Requests
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The number of RADIUS packets received from unknown clients or remote RADIUS servers.

ANALYSIS.NAME: NPS Authentication Server Malformed Packets
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The number of packets containing malformed data received.

ANALYSIS.NAME: NPS Authentication Server Unknown Type
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The number of unknown type (non-RADIUS) packets received.
